did.unittitle: Office of the Provost, Finance and Administration Records

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Duke University. Office of the Provost. Finance and Administration

did.abstract: The Finance and Administration group is a part of the Office of the Provost of Duke University responsible for budgets and cost planning of all academic and administrative units under the Provost, as well as human resources, space planning, and the university's support of Duke Kunshan University. The collection includes materials related to planning and opening of Duke Kunshan University, student financial aid, and other topics.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Finance and Administration group is a part of the Office of the Provost of Duke University. Finance and Administration is responsible for coordinating the budgets, cost allocations, and budget reporting of academic and administrative units under the Provost; administering human resources for all areas under the Provost; facilitating Duke's global activities, including support of Duke Kunshan University; managing the administration of student and faculty technology systems; and facilitating space planning and allocation, among other activities. Offices and groups that report to Finance and Administration include Budget and Finance, the Duke Kunshan University Support Unit, Human Resources, Faculty Affairs and Records, and Institutional Research.
James S. Roberts is the Executive Vice Provost for Finance and Administration and has been in the Office of the Provost since the mid-1990s.
Sources: Office of the Provost, Finance and Administration website, https://finance.provost.duke.edu/, viewed 2017 August 01.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: For a period of twenty-five years from the origin of the material, permission in writing from the office of origin and the University Archivist is required for use of administrative records. After twenty-five years, records that have been processed may be consulted with the permission of the University Archivist.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Copyright for Official University records is held by Duke University; all other copyright is retained by the authors of items in these papers, or their descendants, as stipulated by United States copyright law.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Office of the Provost, Finance and Administration Records were received by the Duke University Archives as a transfer in 2017 and 2019.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Office of the Provost, Finance and Administration Records, Duke University Archives, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Tracy M. Jackson, August 2017. 2019 accession added by Tracy M. Jackson, July 2019.
Accessions described in this collection guide: UA2017.0035, UA2019.0053.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Office of the Provost: John Strohbehn Records, 1994-1999, Duke University Archives, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.
Office of the Provost, Peter Lange Records 1999-2014, Duke University Archives, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Includes materials related to planning, construction, and opening of Duke Kunshan University; planning and reporting related to student financial aid; university strategic planning; and other topics. The collection has not yet been processed.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Records of the University's Board of Trustees which have been in existence for at least fifty years are available for scholarly research with the permission of the University Archivist. Access to records which have been in existence for less than fifty years shall be granted only by special permission, in writing, from the Board of Trustees.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: In accordance with the Family Education Rights and Privacy Act of 1974 as amended, Duke University permits students to inspect their education records and limits the disclosure of personally identifiable information from education records.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Records, such as search committee files or others pertaining to employment where individuals are identified, are closed for 70 years.
